biotools.summary:
ASAP (Assemble Species by Automatic Partitioning) is a method to build species partitions from single locus sequence alignments.
ASAP is the implementation of a hierarchical clustering algorithm that only uses pairwise genetic distances, avoiding the computational burden of phylogenetic reconstruction. Importantly, ASAP proposes species partitions ranked by a new scoring system that uses no biological prior insight of intraspecific diversity.

bioschemas.name: ASAP
